name: Easy Vietnamese Pan-Fried Spicy Lemongrass Chicken (Gà Chiên Sả Ớt)
description: If you are looking for an easy Vietnamese chicken recipe, then look no further. This spicy lemongrass chicken cooks up on the stovetop in under 15 minutes. Flavorful crispy lemongrass chicken that goes wonderfully with steamed rice.
keywords: vietnamese lemongrass chicken, vietnamese lemongrass chicken recipe, chicken recipe, easy chicken recipe, ga chien sa ot, gà chiên sả ớt, ga chien, how to make ga chien sa ot, easy vietnamese pan-fried spicy lemongrass chicken, spicy lemongrass chicken recipe, lemongrass chicken, spicy lemongrass chicken, easy lemongrass chicken, how to eat lemongrass, how to cut lemongrass, what is lemongrass, quick and easy lemongrass chicken, vietnamese lemongrass chicken stir fry, pan fried lemongrass chicken, stovetop lemongrass chicken recipe, stovetop lemongrass chicken, pan fry chicken recipe, pan fry lemongrass chicken, vietnamese lemongrass recipes, lemongrass recipe, spicy chicken recipe, lemongrass chicken with rice recipe, lemongrass chicken with rice, chicken thigh recipes, vietnamese lemongrass chicken thighs, asian stir fry chicken recipe, asian lemongrass chicken recipe, asian lemongrass chicken
recipeIngredient: 1 lb chicken thighs cut into bite-size pieces (skin-in, bone-in preferred)
recipeInstructions: Heat up oil in a medium-size wok or skillet on high heat. Add chicken and toss for about 10 minutes or until golden brown on all sides.
Push the chicken to the side to clear the center of the skillet. Add garlic, lemongrass, shallots, and chili peppers. Pan fry until fragrant (about 30 seconds) then combine with the chicken.
Season with fish and sugar. Add a little at a time to taste. Continue to cook for another 2-4 minutes until chicken is caramelized.
Garnish with thinly sliced green onions and serve immediately for best results.
